Package Math

Class Matrix4x4

java.lang.Object
Math.Matrix4x4
public class Matrix4x4 extends Object
This is the Matrix4x4 class, it contains the definition of a 4x4 matrix, and associated functions to transform it.

  • Method Details

    • InitIdentity

      public Matrix4x4 InitIdentity()
      This function turns this Matrix4x4 into an identity matrix
      Returns:
      Returns an identity matrix

    • InitTranslation

      public Matrix4x4 InitTranslation(float x, float y, float z)
      This function calculates and returns a translation Matrix4x4 with the given parameters
      Parameters:
      x - 0 row 3 column element of the matrix
      y - 1 row 3 column element of the matrix
      z - 2 row 3 column of the matrix
      Returns:
      Returns the translation Matrix4x4 with the given parameters

    • InitRotation

      public Matrix4x4 InitRotation(float x, float y, float z)
      This function calculates and returns a rotation matrix with the given parameters
      Parameters:
      x - Parameter to calculate 11,12,21,22 elements of the first matrix
      y - Parameter to calculate 00,02,20,22 elements of the second matrix
      z - Parameter to calculate 00,01,10,11 elements of the third matrix
      Returns:
      Returns the rotation Matrix4x4 calculated with the given parameters

    • InitRotation

      public Matrix4x4 InitRotation(Vector3f forward, Vector3f up)
      This function calculates and returns rotation matrix with the given parameters of the camera
      Parameters:
      forward - The forward direction vector of the camera
      up - The upward direction vector of the camera
      Returns:
      Returns rotation matrix

    • InitRotation

      public Matrix4x4 InitRotation(Vector3f forward, Vector3f up, Vector3f right)
      This function calculates and returns rotation matrix with the given parameters of the camera
      Parameters:
      forward - The forward direction vector of the camera
      up - The upward direction vector of the camera
      right - The right direction vector of the camera
      Returns:
      Returns rotation matrix

    • InitScale

      public Matrix4x4 InitScale(float x, float y, float z)
      This function calculates and returns a scale matrix with the given parameters
      Parameters:
      x - 0 row 0 column element of the matrix
      y - 1 row 1 column element of the matrix
      z - 2 row 2 column element of the matrix
      Returns:
      Returns a Matrix4x4 with x,y,z,1 on the main diagonal

    • InitPerspective

      public Matrix4x4 InitPerspective(float fov, float aspectRatio, float zNear, float zFar)
      This function calculates and returns the perspective matrix for given parameters
      Parameters:
      fov - the field of view
      aspectRatio - the aspect ratio
      zFar - the maximum view distance
      zNear - the minimum view distance
      Returns:
      Returns the perspective Matrix4x4 for given parameters

    • InitProjection

      public Matrix4x4 InitProjection(float fov, float width, float height, float zNear, float zFar)
      This function calculates and returns the projection matrix for given parameters of a camera
      Parameters:
      fov - The field of view
      width - The parameter for width
      height - The parameter for height
      zFar - The maximum view distance
      zNear - The minimum view distance
      Returns:
      Returns the projection Matrix4x4 for given parameters of a camera

    • InitCamera

      public Matrix4x4 InitCamera(Vector3f forward, Vector3f up)
      This function calculates and returns camera matrix for given parameters of camera
      Parameters:
      forward - The forward direction vector of the camera
      up - The upward direction vector of the camera
      Returns:
      Returns the camera matrix

    • Mul

      public Matrix4x4 Mul(Matrix4x4 r)
      This function multiplies the current Matrix4x4 with a second Matrix4x4
      Parameters:
      r - The Matrix4x4 to multiply by
      Returns:
      Returns the product of the multiplication
